memberdef.definition: quint8(* DsoCommand::minRangeFunc) (const PokitProduct product, const quint32 maxValue)
memberdef.name: minRangeFunc

briefdescription.para: Pointer to function for converting rangeOptionValue to a Pokit device's range enumerator.

detaileddescription.para: This function pointer is assigned during the command line parsing, but is not invoked until after the device's services are discovere, because prior to that discovery, we don't know which product (Meter vs Pro vs Clamp, etc) we're talking to and thus which enumerator list to be using.
If the current mode does not support ranges (eg diode, and continuity modes), then this member will be nullptr.

briefdescription.para: The parsed value of range option.
Bluetooth service this command interracts with.
Settings for the Pokit device's DSO mode.
Number of samples we're expecting in the current window.
Whether or not to show a header as the first line of CSV output.
Construct a new DsoCommand object with parent.
Returns a list of CLI option names required by this command.

detaileddescription.para: The main console appication may use this list to output an eror (and exit) if any of the returned names are not found in the parsed CLI options.

The (already parsed) parser may be used adjust the returned required options depending on the value of other options. For example, the logger command only requires the --mode option if the --command option is start.
This base implementation simply returns an empty list. Derived classes should override this function to include any required options.

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of CLI option names supported by this command.

detaileddescription.para: The main console appication may use this list to output a warning for any parsed CLI options not included in the returned list.

The (already parsed) parser may be used adjust the returned supported options depending on the value of other options. For example, the logger command only supported the --timestamp option if the --command option is start.
This base implementation simply returns requiredOptions(). Derived classes should override this function to include optional options, such as:

briefdescription.para: Processes the relevant options from the command line parser.

detaileddescription.para: This implementation extends DeviceCommand::processOptions to process additional CLI options supported (or required) by this command.

briefdescription.para: Returns a Pokit service object for the derived command class.

detaileddescription.para: This override returns a pointer to a DsoService object.
This override fetches the current device's status, and outputs it in the selected format.

briefdescription.para: Invoked when the DSO settings have been written.
Invoked when metadata has been received from the DSO.
Outputs DSO samples in the selected ouput format.
The DsoCommand class implements the dso CLI command.
